channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sell Yourself First: Why Leadership Beats Product in the AI Era
item.description: Companies increasingly need to rely on employees and customers trusting the founder as the ultimate differentiator.

item.title: Why AI Isn’t Up to Replacing This Digital Job
item.description: Despite the hype and growing presence of AI in the workplace, there are a few human gigs it’s not yet ready to replace.

item.title: How to Build a Business Without a Blueprint
item.description: These three drivers are critical to successfully scaling from startup to long-term success.

item.title: Economists calculated the cost of Trump’s tariffs for Americans. The numbers are staggering
item.description: Tariffs aren’t just bad for business and consumers: They will also increase the number of Americans living in poverty, according to new research. An a...

item.title: Is Oracle’s stock spike the strongest indicator yet that we’re in an AI bubble?
item.description: Even if you only pay a little attention to the business world, it’s been hard to miss Oracle’s phenomenal week. The company’s shares jumped nearly 40%...

item.title: Why the founder CEO of $22 billion Ramp tracks every single day his unicorn startup has been in existence
item.description: Two thousand three hundred and sixty-seven days. Exactly.

item.title: Why Encouraging Workplace Friendships Benefits Your Business
item.description: A new survey finds a vast majority of employees view connections to colleagues as essential to their happiness and productivity.

item.title: Opendoor brings back its founders plus a new CEO from Shopify—who could earn $2.8 billion if he sends the stock soaring
item.description: If Kaz Netjatian can clear all the performance hurdles in his compensation package, he’ll own 11.6% of the tech company.

item.title: Why Verily’s promise of precision health faces precision scrutiny
item.description: A whistleblower is suing Alphabet , claiming that Verily , its health tech subsidiary, breached proper protocol for handling the sensitive health data...

item.title: Immigration raid at Hyundai battery plant to cause a 2–3 month delay, CEO says
item.description: A battery plant co-owned by Hyundai Motor is facing a minimum delay of two to three months following an immigration raid last week, Hyundai’s CEO Jose...

item.title: How Gen Alpha is set to change the game: What to expect from the next generation
item.description: Generation Alpha is poised to redefine industries, reshape digital culture, and drive innovation like never before.

item.title: What Scaling Under Pressure Teaches You About Leadership
item.description: Growth without pressure doesn’t teach you much but growth under pressure teaches you everything.

item.title: Dow closes over 46K for first time, joins S&P and Nasdaq in booking new records
Adobe’s stock rises as earnings beat shows that AI is finally paying off
Stocks and bonds are sending very different messages about recession risks
Figure's IPO sizzles as investors stay hungry for crypto deals
Adobe’s stock has fallen after its last four earnings. Can AI finally deliver?
$16 billion Twilio CEO wakes at 4:30 a.m., works Sundays and runs laps around his house between meetings to blow off steam
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Running a $16 billion company looks like 4:30 a.m. starts, working on Sundays and running laps around the house to blow off steam—and Twili...

item.title: Third Space’s CEO follows an 80/20 rule for eating out, competes in triathlons at 54-years-old and made startup investments he regrets
item.description: Third Space CEO’s worst investment? “A handful of startups that have gone bust…”

item.title: Step aside, LinkedIn: Grindr CEO says he has hired workers through the dating app, as the company pitches itself as the new networking platform in town
item.description: Users checking into the dating app to see how many feet they are from a potential love interest can now expect to be poached, rather than asked out.
